com.ojcoleman.ahni.transcriber

Class HyperNEATTranscriber<T extends Activator>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.transcriber.TranscriberAdaptor<T>
      • com.ojcoleman.ahni.transcriber.HyperNEATTranscriber<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transcriber<T>, Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HyperNEATTranscriberBainBase, HyperNEATTranscriberGridNet

    public abstract class HyperNEATTranscriber<T extends Activator>
extends TranscriberAdaptor<T>
implements Configurable
    To "transcribe" is to construct a phenotype from a genotype. This is a base class for Transcribers implementing the HyperNEAT encoding scheme or extensions thereof. A non-abstract sub-class will typically specify a particular Activator implementation that it creates. See HyperNEATTranscriberBain for an example of a sub-class.
    Author:
    Oliver Coleman

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN
      Provides a wrapper for an Activator that represents a CPPN.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double connectionExprThresh
      The minimum output from the CPPN required to create a non-zero weight value in the substrate.
      protected int connectionRange
      Limits the incoming connections to a target neuron to include those from source neurons within the specified range of the target neuron.
      protected short cppnInputCount
      The number of inputs to the CPPN.
      protected short cppnOutputCount
      The number of outputs from the CPPN.
      protected Transcriber cppnTranscriber
      Transcriber for network for use as a CPPN.
      protected int cyclesPerStep
      For substrate networks with recurrent connections, the number of activation cycles to perform each time the substrate network is presented with new input and queried for its output.
      protected int depth
      The number of layers in the substrate, including input and output layers.
      protected boolean enableBias
      If true indicates that each neuron in the substrate should receive a bias signal.
      protected boolean enableLEO
      If true indicates that Link Expression Output is enabled.
      protected boolean enableNEO
      If true indicates that Neuron Expression Output is enabled.
      protected boolean feedForward
      If true indicates whether the substrate should have a feed-forward topology (no recurrent connections).
      protected int[] height
      The height of each layer in the substrate.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_EXPRESSION_THRESHOLD
      The minimum CPPN output required to produce a non-zero weight in the substrate network.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_RANGE
      Limits the incoming connections to a target neuron to include those from source neurons within the specified range of the target neuron.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_ENABLE_BIAS
      Enable bias connections in the substrate network.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_FEED_FORWARD
      Set to true to restrict the substrate network to a strictly feed-forward topology.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_INCLUDE_ANGLE
      If true indicates that the CPPN should receive the angle in the XY plane between the source and target neuron coordinates (relative to the line X axis).
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_INCLUDE_DELTA
      If true indicates that the CPPN should receive the delta value for each axis between the source and target neuron coordinates.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING
      If true indicates that instead of using a separate output from the CPPN to specify weight values for each weight layer in a feed-forward network, the layer coordinate is input to the CPPN and only a single output from CPPN is used to specify weight values for all weight layers.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO
      Enable or disable Link Expression Output (LEO).
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO_LOCALITY
      Enable or disable seeding of the initial population of Chromosomes to incorporate a bias towards local connections via the Link Expression Output (LEO), see HYPERNEAT_LEO and the article reference within.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD
      Set a threshold for the Link Expression Output (LEO).
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD_DIRECTION
      Enable multiplying the threshold for the Link Expression Output (LEO) by a factor depending on the direction of the synapse with respect to the Z axis.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD_DISTANCE
      Enable multiplying the threshold for the Link Expression Output (LEO) by the square of the distance between the source and target neurons.
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_NEO
      Enable or disable Neuron Expression Output (NEO).
      static java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_NEO_THRESHOLD
      Set a threshold for the Neuron Expression Output (NEO).

      If true indicates that the CPPN should receive the angle in the XY plane between the source and target neuron coordinates.
      protected boolean includeDelta
      If true indicates that the CPPN should receive the delta value for each axis between the source and target neuron coordinates.
      protected boolean layerEncodingIsInput
      If true indicates that instead of using a separate output from the CPPN to specify weight values for each weight layer in a feed-forward network, the layer coordinate is input to the CPPN and only a single output from CPPN is used to specify weight values for all weight layers.
      protected double leoThreshold
      Threshold for the Link Expression Output.
      protected double[] leoThresholdFactorDirection 
      protected boolean leoThresholdFactorDistance
      If true the threshold for the Link Expression Output (LEO) is multiplied by the square of the distance between the source and target neurons.
      protected double neoThreshold
      Threshold for the Neuron Expression Output.
      static java.lang.String NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER
      The coordinates of neurons in a specified layer.

      Custom positions for all neurons in the network.
      static java.lang.String RANGE_X
      The coordinate range of neurons in the substrate in the X dimension, corresponding to the width (this is used to determine the input to the CPPN for a given neuron location).
      static java.lang.String RANGE_Y
      The coordinate range of neurons in the substrate in the Y dimension, corresponding to the height (this is used to determine the input to the CPPN for a given neuron location).
      static java.lang.String RANGE_Z
      The coordinate range of neurons in the substrate in the Z dimension, corresponding to the depth (this is used to determine the input to the CPPN for a given neuron location).
      protected Range rangeX
      Used by HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN to translate from the default range [0, 1] to the range specified by RANGE_X.
      protected Range rangeY
      Used by HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN to translate from the default range [0, 1] to the range specified by RANGE_Y.
      protected Range rangeZ
      Used by HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN to translate from the default range [0, 1] to the range specified by RANGE_Z.
      static java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_CYCLES_PER_STEP
      For recurrent networks, the number of activation cycles to perform each time the substrate network is presented with new input and queried for its output.
      static java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_DEPTH
      Deprecated. 
      The number of layers in the substrate network. This is no longer used, the depth is now determined by the number of elements in ann.hyperneat.height and ann.hyperneat.width.
      static java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_HEIGHT
      Comma separated list of the height of each layer in the network, including input and output layers and starting with the input layer.
      static java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_WIDTH
      Comma separated list of the width of each layer in the network, including input and output layers and starting with the input layer.
      protected int[] width
      The width of each layer in the substrate.
      protected java.lang.String zCoordsForCPPN
      Subclasses may set this to "force" or "prevent" before calling super.init(Properties) to either force or prevent the use of Z coordinate inputs for the CPPN (both source and target neuron Z coordinates will be affected).

      • HYPERNEAT_FEED_FORWARD

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_FEED_FORWARD
        Set to true to restrict the substrate network to a strictly feed-forward topology.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_ENABLE_BIAS
        Enable bias connections in the substrate network.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_INCLUDE_DELTA

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_INCLUDE_DELTA
        If true indicates that the CPPN should receive the delta value for each axis between the source and target neuron coordinates.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_INCLUDE_ANGLE

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_INCLUDE_ANGLE
        If true indicates that the CPPN should receive the angle in the XY plane between the source and target neuron coordinates (relative to the line X axis).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING
        If true indicates that instead of using a separate output from the CPPN to specify weight values for each weight layer in a feed-forward network, the layer coordinate is input to the CPPN and only a single output from CPPN is used to specify weight values for all weight layers.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_EXPRESSION_THRESHOLD

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_EXPRESSION_THRESHOLD
        The minimum CPPN output required to produce a non-zero weight in the substrate network. Actual weight values will scale from [0, ann.transcriber.connection.weight.max] or [ann.transcriber.connection.weight.min, 0].
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_RANGE

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_RANGE
        Limits the incoming connections to a target neuron to include those from source neurons within the specified range of the target neuron. Set this to -1 to disable it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_DEPTH

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_DEPTH
        Deprecated. The number of layers in the substrate network. This is no longer used, the depth is now determined by the number of elements in ann.hyperneat.height and ann.hyperneat.width.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_HEIGHT

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_HEIGHT
        Comma separated list of the height of each layer in the network, including input and output layers and starting with the input layer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_WIDTH

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_WIDTH
        Comma separated list of the width of each layer in the network, including input and output layers and starting with the input layer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RANGE_X

        public static final java.lang.String RANGE_X
        The coordinate range of neurons in the substrate in the X dimension, corresponding to the width (this is used to determine the input to the CPPN for a given neuron location). Defaults to [0, 1].
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RANGE_Y

        public static final java.lang.String RANGE_Y
        The coordinate range of neurons in the substrate in the Y dimension, corresponding to the height (this is used to determine the input to the CPPN for a given neuron location). Defaults to [0, 1].
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RANGE_Z

        public static final java.lang.String RANGE_Z
        The coordinate range of neurons in the substrate in the Z dimension, corresponding to the depth (this is used to determine the input to the CPPN for a given neuron location). Defaults to [0, 1].
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER

        public static final java.lang.String NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER

        The coordinates of neurons in a specified layer. The layer must be specified as part of the property key/name, e.g. to specify the coordinates of two neurons in the layer with index 2 (counting from 0):
        ann.hyperneat.layer.positions.2=(-0.5, 0, 0), (0.5, 0, 0)

        For 2D layers the coordinates should be specified in row-packed order (i.e. one row after another, where a single row has the same y index/coordinate). Coordinates must be specified for all neurons in the given layer. If the z coordinate is not given it will be set to the default for the layer.

        This will override neuron positions specified by the fitness function for the specified layer (if it defines any).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_CYCLES_PER_STEP

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_CYCLES_PER_STEP
        For recurrent networks, the number of activation cycles to perform each time the substrate network is presented with new input and queried for its output.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_LEO

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO
        Enable or disable Link Expression Output (LEO). See P. Verbancsics and K. O. Stanley (2011) Constraining Connectivity to Encourage Modularity in HyperNEAT. In Proceedings of the Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference (GECCO 2011). Default is "false".
        See Also:
        HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD, HYPERNEAT_LEO_LOCALITY, Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD
        Set a threshold for the Link Expression Output (LEO). Default is 0.
        See Also:
        HYPERNEAT_LEO, Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD_DISTANCE

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD_DISTANCE
        Enable multiplying the threshold for the Link Expression Output (LEO) by the square of the distance between the source and target neurons. Default is false.
        See Also:
        HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD, Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD_DIRECTION

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD_DIRECTION
        Enable multiplying the threshold for the Link Expression Output (LEO) by a factor depending on the direction of the synapse with respect to the Z axis. Three comma-separated values are required for the reverse, neutral and forward directions, respectively. This could be used to help inhibit non-feed-forward, recurrent links. Default is 1,1,1 (i.e. no directional factor).
        See Also:
        HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD, Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_LEO_LOCALITY

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_LEO_LOCALITY
        Enable or disable seeding of the initial population of Chromosomes to incorporate a bias towards local connections via the Link Expression Output (LEO), see HYPERNEAT_LEO and the article reference within. Default is "false".
        See Also:
        HYPERNEAT_LEO, Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_NEO

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_NEO
        Enable or disable Neuron Expression Output (NEO). Similar to the Link Expression Output (LEO), but for neurons. Default is "false".
        See Also:
        HYPERNEAT_NEO_THRESHOLD, HYPERNEAT_LEO, Constant Field Values

      • HYPERNEAT_NEO_THRESHOLD

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_NEO_THRESHOLD
        Set a threshold for the Neuron Expression Output (NEO). Default is 0.
        See Also:
        HYPERNEAT_NEO, Constant Field Values

      • width

        protected int[] width
        The width of each layer in the substrate.

      • height

        protected int[] height
        The height of each layer in the substrate.

      • depth

        protected int depth
        The number of layers in the substrate, including input and output layers.

      • rangeX

        protected Range rangeX
        Used by HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN to translate from the default range [0, 1] to the range specified by RANGE_X.

      • rangeY

        protected Range rangeY
        Used by HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN to translate from the default range [0, 1] to the range specified by RANGE_Y.

      • rangeZ

        protected Range rangeZ
        Used by HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN to translate from the default range [0, 1] to the range specified by RANGE_Z.

      • neuronPositionsForLayer

        protected Point[][] neuronPositionsForLayer
        Custom positions for all neurons in the network. This is used when either the NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER property is used and/or the fitness function defines some/all neuron layers and positions. The coordinates are in the ranges rangeX, rangeY and rangeZ (rather than unit ranges).

      • feedForward

        protected boolean feedForward
        If true indicates whether the substrate should have a feed-forward topology (no recurrent connections).

      • enableBias

        protected boolean enableBias
        If true indicates that each neuron in the substrate should receive a bias signal.

      • includeDelta

        protected boolean includeDelta
        If true indicates that the CPPN should receive the delta value for each axis between the source and target neuron coordinates.

      • includeAngle

        protected boolean includeAngle
        If true indicates that the CPPN should receive the angle in the XY plane between the source and target neuron coordinates.

      • connectionExprThresh

        protected double connectionExprThresh
        The minimum output from the CPPN required to create a non-zero weight value in the substrate.

      • connectionRange

        protected int connectionRange
        Limits the incoming connections to a target neuron to include those from source neurons within the specified range of the target neuron. A value of -1 indicates that this is disabled.

      • layerEncodingIsInput

        protected boolean layerEncodingIsInput
        If true indicates that instead of using a separate output from the CPPN to specify weight values for each weight layer in a feed-forward network, the layer coordinate is input to the CPPN and only a single output from CPPN is used to specify weight values for all weight layers.

      • cyclesPerStep

        protected int cyclesPerStep
        For substrate networks with recurrent connections, the number of activation cycles to perform each time the substrate network is presented with new input and queried for its output.

      • enableLEO

        protected boolean enableLEO
        If true indicates that Link Expression Output is enabled.

      • leoThreshold

        protected double leoThreshold
        Threshold for the Link Expression Output.

      • leoThresholdFactorDistance

        protected boolean leoThresholdFactorDistance
        If true the threshold for the Link Expression Output (LEO) is multiplied by the square of the distance between the source and target neurons.

      • leoThresholdFactorDirection

        protected double[] leoThresholdFactorDirection
        See Also:
        HYPERNEAT_LEO_THRESHOLD_DIRECTION

      • enableNEO

        protected boolean enableNEO
        If true indicates that Neuron Expression Output is enabled.

      • neoThreshold

        protected double neoThreshold
        Threshold for the Neuron Expression Output.

      • cppnInputCount

        protected short cppnInputCount
        The number of inputs to the CPPN.
        See Also:

      • cppnOutputCount

        protected short cppnOutputCount
        The number of outputs from the CPPN.
        See Also:
        getCPPNOutputCount()

      • cppnTranscriber

        protected Transcriber cppnTranscriber
        Transcriber for network for use as a CPPN. Not usually accessed directly, see HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN.

      • zCoordsForCPPN

        protected java.lang.String zCoordsForCPPN
        Subclasses may set this to "force" or "prevent" before calling super.init(Properties) to either force or prevent the use of Z coordinate inputs for the CPPN (both source and target neuron Z coordinates will be affected).

      • init

        public void init(Properties props)
        This method should be called from overriding methods.
        Specified by:
        init in interface Configurable

        init in class TranscriberAdaptor<T extends Activator>
        Parameters:
        props - Configuration parameters.
        See Also:
        Configurable.init(Properties)

      • getProvisionalLayerSize

        public static int[] getProvisionalLayerSize(Properties props,
                            java.lang.String sizeKey)
        Returns provisional width or height values for each layer of the substrate. Any values that are to be determined by the fitness function have value -1.
        Parameters:
        props - The properties to read the size from.
        sizeKey - Whether to retrieve width or height values, allowed values are SUBSTRATE_WIDTH or SUBSTRATE_HEIGHT.
        Returns:
        An array containing values for the width or height of each layer of the substrate.

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Get the number of layers in the substrate, including input and output layers.

      • getWidth

        public int[] getWidth()
        Get the width of each layer in the substrate.

      • getHeight

        public int[] getHeight()
        Get the height of each layer in the substrate.

      • getConnectionRange

        public int getConnectionRange()
        Get the limit of the range of connections, this limits the incoming connections to a target neuron to include those from source neurons within the specified range of the target neuron. This is not implemented by all transcribers. A value of -1 indicates that this is disabled.

      • resize

        public void resize(int[] width,
          int[] height,
          int connectionRange)
        Specify new dimensions for each layer. If connection range is not used it can be set to -1.

      • getCPPNIndexDeltaX

        public int getCPPNIndexDeltaX()
        Returns:
        the index in the CPPN inputs for the delta (difference) for the x coordinates (the difference between the x coordinates of the source and target neurons). Returns -1 if this input is not enabled.

      • getCPPNIndexDeltaY

        public int getCPPNIndexDeltaY()
        Returns:
        the index in the CPPN inputs for the delta (difference) for the y coordinates (the difference between the y coordinates of the source and target neurons). Returns -1 if this input is not enabled.

      • getCPPNIndexDeltaZ

        public int getCPPNIndexDeltaZ()
        Returns:
        the index in the CPPN inputs for the delta (difference) for the z coordinates (the difference between the z coordinates of the source and target neurons). Returns -1 if this input is not enabled.

      • getCPPNIndexAngle

        public int getCPPNIndexAngle()
        Returns:
        the index in the CPPN inputs for the angle in the XY plane between the source and target neuron coordinates (relative to the line X axis). Returns -1 if this input is not enabled.

      • getCPPNIndexWeight

        public int[] getCPPNIndexWeight()
        Returns:
        an array containing the indexes in the CPPN outputs for the weight value(s).

      • getCPPNIndexBiasOutput

        public int[] getCPPNIndexBiasOutput()
        Returns:
        an array containing the indexes in the CPPN outputs for the bias value(s). Returns [-1] if this output is not enabled.

      • getCPPNIndexLEO

        public int[] getCPPNIndexLEO()
        Returns:
        an array containing the indexes in the CPPN outputs for the Link Expression Output (LEO) value(s). Returns [-1] if this output is not enabled.
